Getting Started

Welcome to the Misty Showcase documentation! This guide will help you get started with block-based Python programming for the Misty robot.

What is Misty Showcase?

Misty Showcase is a block-based programming environment that allows you to create Python programs for the Misty robot without writing code directly. The visual blocks are automatically converted to Python code that can run in simulation or on a real Misty robot.

System Requirements

To use Misty Showcase, you need:

  • A modern web browser (Chrome, Firefox, Edge, or Safari)
  • Internet connection for loading resources
  • Optional: Misty robot for deploying your programs to hardware

Your First Program

To create your first program:

  1. From the homepage, select the workspace area
  2. Drag blocks from the toolbox on the left into the workspace
  3. Click "Generate Python Code" to see the Python equivalent
  4. Click "Run Code" to execute in the simulator

Blocks Overview

Blocks are grouped by category to help you find what you need. Here's an overview of the available blocks:

Logic Blocks

Logic blocks help control the flow of your program with conditions and comparisons:

  • If/Else - Execute code based on conditions
  • Comparison - Compare values (equal, greater than, less than)
  • Boolean - Use true/false values

Example:

if sensor_value > 10:
    misty.drive_forward(1)
else:
    misty.stop()

Loop Blocks

Loop blocks allow you to repeat actions:

  • Repeat - Run code a specific number of times
  • While - Run code while a condition is true
  • For Each - Process each item in a list

Math Blocks

Math blocks provide arithmetic operations and number handling:

  • Basic Operations - Add, subtract, multiply, divide
  • Random - Generate random numbers
  • Round - Round numbers to integers

Misty API

The Misty API blocks provide access to robot functions and capabilities.

Movement Functions

Control how Misty moves around:

Function Parameters Description
drive_forward() speed (0-1) Move the robot forward at specified speed
turn() degrees (-360 to 360) Rotate the robot by specified degrees
stop() none Stop all movement immediately

Sensors

Access Misty's sensors to perceive the environment:

  • Distance Sensors - Detect obstacles
  • Light Sensors - Measure ambient light
  • Touch Sensors - Detect when Misty is touched

Audio & Display

Control Misty's audio output and face display:

  • Play Sound - Play audio files or tones
  • Change Expression - Change the facial expression
  • Display Text - Show text on Misty's display

Example Projects

Learn by exploring these example projects:

  • Basic Navigation - Simple movement with obstacle avoidance
  • Follow the Line - Using sensors to follow a path
  • Interactive Greeter - Responding to people with sounds and expressions

Access these examples from the "Templates" dropdown in the navigation bar.

Troubleshooting

Common Issues

  • Simulator Not Responding

    Try refreshing the page or checking your browser compatibility.

  • Code Not Running

    Check the output window for error messages. Make sure all blocks are properly connected.

  • Robot Connection Issues

    Ensure the "Use Real Misty API" toggle is enabled and your robot is on the same network.

FAQ

Can I export my code to use outside of Misty Showcase?

Yes, you can copy the generated Python code and use it in any Python environment that supports the Misty API.

Do I need a real Misty robot to use this platform?

No, you can use the simulator for testing and learning without a physical robot.

Can I create custom blocks?

Currently, custom blocks are not supported, but we're working on this feature for future releases.
